meanings.definition: To cause to adhere; to unite or combine into a mass.
meanings.sent1: The glue will agglutinate the pieces together.
meanings.sent2: Mixing the ingredients will agglutinate them into a dough.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally agglutinated my fingers with super glue!
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to agglutinate into a powerful speech.
meanings.sent5: The snowflakes agglutinated into a beautiful snowman.

meanings.definition: To form words by combining morphemes without changing them.
meanings.sent1: In this language, you can agglutinate words easily.
meanings.sent2: Linguists study how languages agglutinate words.
meanings.sent3: I tried to agglutinate words, but it sounded funny!
meanings.sent4: His ideas agglutinated into a brilliant new theory.
meanings.sent5: The colors agglutinated into a vibrant painting.
